author: David McDonnell
title: Sergio Aguero signs contract extension at Manchester City - but Pep Guardiola demands more from his striker
text:
Pep Guardiola on Gabriel Jesus' chances of facing Spurs Share this video Watch Next 
“Last game, the cross for Sergio, nothing, he don’t arrive there. I don’t know the other managers, to give some advice in the box to score a goal. 
“It’s so difficult to improve, because it depends on the quality of the players. For example, the second goal against Burnley, it’s almost impossible to do it and he did it, that shows his talent.” 
Despite City failing to formally announce Aguero’s contract extension, Guardiola confirmed the forward, who has 18 goals this season, has committed to an extra year. 
“He has already signed a contract extension,” said Guardiola. “Sergio will be here until he decides to be here. Aguero has 18 goals this season (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Transfer news LIVE: All the latest from the January window 
“He’s our best striker. We have a problem with goals, so we need him. What I want is the best possible. He will decide [when he leaves], not me.” 
Aguero has yet to score against any of the other sides in the top seven of the Premier League this season, a statistic not lost on Guardiola. 
“He knows that, I know that, but we don’t discuss about that,” said Guardiola. 
“He will score against a top team, they are good teams. But we have to try to help him to score against the top teams.” poll loading Will Sergio Aguero finish the season as the Premier League top goalscorer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
